name: Siqiang Luo
content: Siqiang Luo | Siqiang Luo's Homepage top of page This website was built on Wix. Create yours today.Get StartedSiqiang Luo ​（骆思强）Assistant Professorsiqiang.luo@ntu.edu.sgGoogle ScholarThis homepage will not be maintained any more. Please visit my new homepage here at https://siqiangluo.com/ Short Bio. I am a Nanyang Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science and Engineering, Nanyang Technological University. I am also affiliated with DANTE. I received my B.S. and M.S. degrees in computer science from Fudan University, and a Ph.D. degree in computer science from the University of Hong Kong (working with Prof. Ben Kao and Prof. Reynold Cheng). I also did a Postdoc at Harvard University (working with Prof. Stratos Idreos).Research Interest. I am broadly interested in big data management algorithms and systems, particularly in the following areas: 1) Scalable graph algorithms/systems. Focus on optimizing fundamental graph analytical problems, such as PageRanks, GNNs and Community Search. 2) Scalable key-value systems. Focus on optimizing the performance of key-value stores such as RocksDB, particularly in filter and index designs. 3) Machine-learning driven data management.Hiring. A few openings for Ph.D.s and PostDocs. Please send me your CV if you are interested in working with me. I regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.Selected Publications (Full List in DBLP)​​​​ COCLEP: Contrastive Learning-based Semi-Supervised Community Search.
